title: Identify Font Used on Vintage Trucks
content:
A client has sent me two samples of typography he would like to try and incorporate into a brochure.

Sorry for the poor quality of the copies.

Can anyone identify the larger font used on both samples. There may not be enough information for a exact match but if a font name jumps to mind it would be appreciated.

I realize both of these samples could be custom hand drawn letters and not part of font but if what you see suggests a font I would appreciate your suggestions.

Thank you in advance.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [truck\_type\_sample\_01.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720062321/http:/typophile.com/files/truck_type_sample_01.jpg) | 81.86 KB |
| [truck\_type\_sample\_02.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720062321/http:/typophile.com/files/truck_type_sample_02.jpg) | 118.02 KB |

 [‹ 'Shattered' Font ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720062321/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44781 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looking for a free alternative for Schwung by Hubert Jocham ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720062321/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44747 "Go to next forum topic")
author: B Bohnhoff

comments.content: You might like Ephemera, Ballpark Script or Chicago Script from Letterhead Fonts. Or Font Bureau’s Casey.
WOW! All great suggestions. I appreciate the leads to new sources for fonts. Thank you.
